info.title: Software and Compute Entity Management
info.description:
This API introduces schemas mapping the Software and Compute ABE
to the TM Forum Open API data model.

The existing Resource domain APIs for Catalog (634), Inventory (639),
Activation (664, 702) and Ordering (652) should be used with the
subtypes of Resource/ResourceSpecification introduced in this OAS.

resourceSpecCharacteristic.description: A characteristic quality or distinctive feature of a ResourceSpecification.  The characteristic can be take on a discrete value, such as color, can take on a range of values, (for example, sensitivity of 100-240 mV), or can be derived from a formula (for example, usage time (hrs) = 30 - talk time *3). Certain characteristics, such as color, may be configured during the ordering or some other process.

targetResourceSchema.description: A target resource schema reference. The reference object to the schema and type of target resource which is described by resource specification.

validFor.description: The period for which this REST resource is valid

CharacteristicSpecificationBase.description: This class defines a characteristic specification.

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the target Characteristic is configurable

description.description: A narrative that explains the CharacteristicSpecification.

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for a resource.

isUnique.description: Specifies if the value of this characteristic is unique across all entities instantiated from the specification that uses this characteristc. For example, consider a ProductSpecification for a set-top box, with a CharacteristicSpecification cardID. Each set-top box must have a different value for cardID, so this isUnique attribute would be set to true for the characteristic.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which this characteristic specification is known and distinguished from other characteristic specifications.

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular JsonLdExpression used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

validFor.description: The period of time for which a characteristic is applicable.

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type.

CharacteristicValueSpecification.description: specification of a value (number or text or an object) that can be assigned to a Characteristic.

isDefault.description: If true, the Boolean Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: A regular JsonLdExpression constraint for given value

unitOfMeasure.description: A length, surface, volume, dry measure, liquid measure, money, weight, time, and the like. In general, a determinate quantity or magnitude of the kind designated, taken as a standard of comparison for others of the same kind, in assigning to them numerical values, as 1 foot, 1 yard, 1 mile, 1 square foot.

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic value can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

validFor.description: The period of time for which a value is applicable.

value.description: A discrete value that the characteristic can take on, or the actual value of the characteristic

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

isDistributedCurrent.description: True defines this SoftwareResource as being currently distributed across several Resource nodes.

lastStartTime.description: The time of the last start of this software.

lastUpdate.description: The time of the last update of this resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

numProcessesActiveCurrent.description: The current number of total processes that the Software can support at any given time.

numUsersCurrent.description: The ccurrent number of users of the Sofware.

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

serialNumber.description: A set of identifying characters and/or numbers assigned to, and usually marked on, each of a series of identical Software instances

administrativeState.description: Tracks the administrative state of the resource, such as locked, unlocked, shutdown and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the operational state of the resource, such as enable, disable and so on.

pagingFileSizeCurrent.description: Defines the current number, and size of, stored paging files for the software. If this instance doesn't support paging files, then the value of this attribute should be 0.

processMemorySizeCurrent.description: The amount of memory currently allocated to a process.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the resource status of the resource, such as standby, alarm, available, reserved, suspended and so on.

swapSpaceUsedCurrent.description: The amount of swap space currently in use. If the Software doesn't distinguish swap space from space used for paging files, then the value of this attribute should be 0.

usageState.description: Tracks the usage state of the resource, such as idle, active, busy and so on.

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

vendor.description: This is a string that defines the name of the manufacturer. This, in combination with the Model and the Part, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute for a physical resource.

ResourceSpecification.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is a base class that represents a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

ResourceSpecificationCharacteristic.description:
This class defines the characteristic features of a resource specification. Every ResourceSpecification has a variety of important attributes, methods, constraints, and
relationships, which distinguish a resource specification from other resource specifications.

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the target Characteristic is configurable

description.description: A narrative that explains the CharacteristicSpecification.

extensible.description: An indicator that specifies that the values for the characteristic can be extended by adding new values when instantiating a characteristic for a resource.

isUnique.description: Specifies if the value of this characteristic is unique across all entities instantiated from the specification that uses this characteristc. For example, consider a ProductSpecification for a set-top box, with a CharacteristicSpecification cardID. Each set-top box must have a different value for cardID, so this isUnique attribute would be set to true for the characteristic.

maxCardinality.description: The maximum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where five is the value for the maxCardinality.

minCardinality.description: The minimum number of instances a CharacteristicValue can take on. For example, zero to five phone numbers in a group calling plan, where zero is the value for the minCardinality.

name.description: A word, term, or phrase by which this characteristic specification is known and distinguished from other characteristic specifications.

regex.description: A rule or principle represented in regular JsonLdExpression used to derive the value of a characteristic value.

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

resourceSpecCharRelationship.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among Specification Characteristics.

resourceSpecCharacteristicValue.description: A CharacteristicValueSpecification object is used to define a set of attributes, each of which can be assigned to a corresponding set of attributes in a ResourceSpecificationCharacteristic object. The values of the attributes in the CharacteristicValueSpecification object describe the values of the attributes that a corresponding ResourceSpecificationCharacteristic object can take on.

validFor.description: The period of time for which a characteristic is applicable.

@type.description: When sub-classing, this defines the sub-class Extensible name

@valueSchemaLocation.description: This (optional) field provides a link to the schema describing the value type.

ResourceSpecificationCharacteristicRelat.description: An aggregation, migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among ResourceSpecificationCharacteristics. The specification characteristic is embedded within the specification whose ID and href are in this entity, and identified by its ID.

ResourceSpecificationRef.description:
Resources are physical or non-physical components (or some combination of these) within an enterprise's infrastructure or inventory. They are typically consumed or used by services (for example a physical port assigned to a service) or contribute to the realization of a Product (for example, a SIM card). They can be drawn from the Application, Computing and Network domains, and include, for example, Network Elements, software, IT systems, content and information, and technology components.
A ResourceSpecification is an abstract base class for representing a generic means for implementing a particular type of Resource. In essence, a ResourceSpecification defines the common attributes and relationships of a set of related Resources, while Resource defines a specific instance that is based on a particular ResourceSpecification.

ResourceSpecificationRelationship.description: A migration, substitution, dependency or exclusivity relationship between/among resource specifications.

defaultQuantity.description: The default number of the related resource that should be instantiated, for example a rack would typically have 4 cards, although it could support more.

maximumQuantity.description: The maximum number of the related resource that should be instantiated, for example a rack supports a maximum of 16 cards

minimumQuantity.description: The minimum number of the related resource that should be instantiated, for example a rack must have at least 1 card

name.description: The name given to the target resource specification instance

relationshipType.description: Type of relationship such as migration, substitution, dependency, exclusivity

role.description: The association role for this resource specification

characteristic.description: A characteristic that refines the relationship. For example, consider the relationship between a slot and a card. For a half-height card it is important to know the position at which the card is inserted, so a characteristic Position might be defined on the relationship to allow capturing of this in the inventory

SoftwareResource.description: Abstract class describing the common set of attributes shared by all concrete software resources (e.g. API, InstalledSoftware)

category.description: Category of the concrete resource. e.g Gold, Silver for MSISDN concrete resource

endOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date till the resource is operating

isDistributedCurrent.description: True defines this SoftwareResource as being currently distributed across several Resource nodes.

lastUpdate.description: The time of the last update of this resource.

name.description: A string used to give a name to the resource

resourceVersion.description: A field that identifies the specific version of an instance of a resource.

startOperatingDate.description: A date time( DateTime). The date from which the resource is operating

targetPlatform.description: Defines the target platform that the SoftwareResource will be deployed on.

value.description: the value of the logical resource. E.g '0746712345' for  MSISDN's

administrativeState.description: Tracks the administrative state of the resource, such as locked, unlocked, shutdown and so on.

operationalState.description: Tracks the operational state of the resource, such as enable, disable and so on.

resourceStatus.description: Tracks the resource status of the resource, such as standby, alarm, available, reserved, suspended and so on.

usageState.description: Tracks the usage state of the resource, such as idle, active, busy and so on.

resourceSpecCharacteristic.description: A characteristic quality or distinctive feature of a ResourceSpecification.  The characteristic can be take on a discrete value, such as color, can take on a range of values, (for example, sensitivity of 100-240 mV), or can be derived from a formula (for example, usage time (hrs) = 30 - talk time *3). Certain characteristics, such as color, may be configured during the ordering or some other process.

SoftwareSupportPackage.description: A SofwareSupportPackage represents the package acquired by a consumer from a software vendor. It can be materialized as one or several files (data) downloaded online or copied on a physical support. It contains all files required for deployment and installation such as installation manager and at minimum, one of the files constitutes the set of machine readable instructions that will be executed automatically after it is installed.

powerState.description:
This defines the current power status of the hardware item. Values include:

  0:  Unknown
  1:  Not Applicable
  2:  No Power Applied
  3: Full Power Applied
  4:  Power Save - Normal
  5:  Power Save - Degraded
  6:  Power Save - Standby
  7:  Power Save - Critical
  8:  Power Save - Low Power Mode
  9:  Power Save - Unknown
 10: Power Cycle
 11: Power Warning
 12: Power Off

model.description: This is a string that represents a manufacturer-allocated number used to identify the general type and/or category of the hardware item. This, in combination with the Part and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

part.description: This is a string that defines a manufacturer-allocated part number assigned by the organization that manufactures the hardware item. This, in combination with the Model and the Vendor, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute.

sku.description: This is a string that defines the manufacturer-allocated Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number of the hardware item. This is an optional attribute.

vendor.description: This is a string that defines the name of the manufacturer. This, in combination with the Model and the Part, identify different types of hardware items. The SerialNumber can then be used to differentiate between different instances of the same type of hardware item. This is a REQUIRED attribute for a physical resource.
